intro: Adenocarpus decorticans, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain the seeds. Adenocarpus decorticans is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
